import React, { useState } from 'react' import { Modal, ModalHeader, ModalBody, ModalFooter, Button, Input, Label } from '@windmill/react-ui' import { addDoc, collection, doc, setDoc, Timestamp } from 'firebase/firestore' import { db } from '../../utils/firebase' import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form' function ModalFormRole({ closeModal, isModalOpen }) { const docData = { roleName: "", description: "", createdAt: Timestamp.now() } const [dataRole, setDataRole] = useState(docData) const handleSubmit = async (e) => { e.preventDefault() try { // await setDoc(doc(db, "roles"), docData); closeModal() } catch (err) { alert(err) } console.log("data", docData); } return ( <> Form Data Role
{/* I don't like this approach. Consider passing a prop to ModalFooter * that if present, would duplicate the buttons in a way similar to this. * Or, maybe find some way to pass something like size="large md:regular" * to Button */}
) } export default ModalFormRole
